story.book

Class Story

  • java.lang.Object
    • story.book.StoryModel<StoryView>
      • story.book.Story

  • public class Story
extends StoryModel<StoryView>
    Main class for representing stories which extends the abstract class StoryModel. The "content" of a Story is a collection of StoryFragment objects. A story also contains an instance of StoryInfo which holds meta information about the story.
    Author:
    Alexander Cheung
    See Also:
    StoryModel, StoryView, StoryFragment, StoryInfo

    • Method Detail

      • addFragment

        public void addFragment(StoryFragment storyFragment)
        Adds the specified StoryFragment object to the end of the fragmentList and notifies associated views.
        Parameters:
        storyFragment - the StoryFragment to be added

      • removeFragment

        public void removeFragment(int storyFragmentID)
        Removes the specified StoryFragment object from the fragmentList and notifies associated views. All DecisionBranch objects in any StoryFragment whose destination is the removed StoryFragment are removed from their containing StoryFragment.
        Parameters:
        storyFragmentID - the ID of the StoryFragment to be removed

      • getStoryInfo

        public StoryInfo getStoryInfo()
        Returns the StoryInfo object associated with the Story.
        Returns:
        the StoryInfo object associated with the Story

      • setStoryInfo

        public void setStoryInfo(StoryInfo storyInfo)
        Sets the StoryInfo object associated with the Story to the StoryInfo object specified in the argument.
        Parameters:
        storyInfo - the StoryInfo object to be assigned to the Story

      • getStoryFragments

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,StoryFragment> getStoryFragments()
        Returns the story's collection of StoryFragment objects
        Returns:
        HashMap containing the story's fragments

      • getNextFragmentID

        public int getNextFragmentID()
        Returns the next available fragment ID
        Returns:
        the next available fragment ID
